required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CPNS Pilot Study: Evaluation of Safety and Performance of the Cardiac Pulmonary Nerve Stimulation (CPNS) System in Patients With ADHF
clinical_study.official_title: The Cardiac Pulmonary Nerve Stimulation (CPNS) Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: The CPNS Pilot Study: An evaluation of the safety and performance of the Cardionomic Cardiac Pulmonary Nerve Stimulation (CPNS) system in patients with acute decompensated heart failure.

detailed_description.textblock: The CPNS Pilot Study is a prospective, multi-center and multinational study to evaluate the safety and performance of the CPNS System in patients hospitalized with acute decompensated heart failure (ADHF). The CPNS System is a neuromodulation system, intended to provide acute (≤5 days) endovascular stimulation of the cardiac autonomic nerves in the right pulmonary artery. The system consists of a temporary neuromodulation stimulator catheter and a stimulator. Approximately 50 patients will be enrolled in the study and will be followed up through 6-months post-discharges from the hospital. Patients assigned to the treatment group will receive CPNS therapy and followed closely in an intensive care unit setting. Patients randomized to the control arm in Phase 2 will receive standard treatment for their heart failure.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Subjects will be assigned to CPNS treatment or to the control arm. Treatment with CPNS system includes endovascular stimulation of the cardiac autonomic nerves in addition to standard of care. Subjects in the control arm will receive the available standard treatment.

primary_outcome.description: The occurrence of all system and/or procedure related adverse events and serious adverse events and deaths

arm_group.description: Treatment with CPNS system: Endovascular stimulation of the cardiac autonomic nerves in addition to standard of care

intervention.description: Endovascular stimulation of the cardiac autonomic nerves in addition to standard of care

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Admitted to hospital with a principal diagnosis of ADHF
- BMI adjusted BNP ≥ 500 pg/mL or NT-proBNP ≥ 2000 pg/mL
- LVEF ≤ 45%
- At least one sign/symptom of fluid overload
- At least one of the following:
- inadequate diuretic response
- least one sign or symptom of low perfusion
Exclusion Criteria:
- First IV treatment upon presentation in hospital to randomization > 48 hours
- Received an inotrope or anticipated to receive an inotrope in the 12 hours following enrollment
- Requires mechanical support or anticipated to receive mechanical support in the 12 hours following enrollment
- Systolic blood pressure < 80mmHg or > 130mmHg
- Symptomatic hypotension
- eGFR < 25 mL/min/1.732
